title: Lagging only in League of Legends (Please save me).
body:
{{item:3070}} {{item:3073}}
I've tried so many hot fixes these past few months to fix this, but I'm at a complete lost. 
I've changed my dns to googles, I've regedit some files to turn off ipv6 and use only ipv4, turn off peer sharing on windows 10, Hextech Repair Tool etc. etc. etc. Nothing has worked for me yet, and these lag spike only happen in League of Legends. I play Overwatch, Counter-Strike, MMOs (yeah i'm a huge nerd), and etc., but the only game I have problems in is League. 

Symptoms: 
Continuous random lag spikes (up to 500ping) throughout the game varying from just plain disconnecting or just iceskating everywhere only to have everything around me frozen and then reanimate back to life for a cluster poop of action. I literally feel like the nexus is blowing up on my screen every 5 mins. This has been on going since patch 6.18 or so... It's been so long now I don't even remember.

My Rig:
Processor: AMD FX(tm)-8320 8-core Processor 3.50Hz
Video Card: AMD Radeon (TM) R9 200 Series 
RAM: 12GB
Obviously 64-bit
USB Wireless Adapter: TP-Link Archer T4U AC1200
60Hz Monitor (Yeah trying to upgrade it #Money)

replies.body:
Since you're using a USB WiFi adapter, I'd recommend bypassing your wireless connection and trying a wired connection as a temporary workaround. There are a few other local network configurations I'd like you to try so we can confirm your settings are in good standing. You can find these settings outlined within our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues).

Please let me know if this was able to resolve your issues or caused any change.

Unfortunately I can't get a wired connection with my current situation :c 

But after using the Netalyzr:

> Summary of Noteworthy Events
> Minor Aberrations
> 
> 
>     Certain TCP protocols are blocked in outbound traffic
>     The network indicated bursts of packet loss
>     Some DNS resolvers appear to be down
>     We received unexpected and possibly dangerous results when looking up important names
>     Only some root servers returned DNSSEC information 
>

Apparently I'm experiencing Packet Loss

Since you're seeing messages about packet loss in your netalyzr report, we'll want to take a look at your network routing to find the issue. I'd like you to use [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) (a free networking app) to perform this test. After loading up the app, simply plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field and start the trace. After you've run the trace for 5 minutes, export your results as text and paste them in a reply to me.

Let me know if you ran into any issues with those steps.

Don't worry too much about formatting, the Boards tends to make these traceroute results look a little funky, which is totally unavoidable. Your traceroute shows some small rises in latency, but nothing crazy like 100ms+ spikes. Did you happen to run this trace during a time you experience these symptoms? You may want to derp around in a custom match alone until you start seeing those symptoms, then *Alt+Tab* out of League and start the trace then.

I hope that gives us the results we need in that traceroute!

There we are, it caught the issues this time around. It looks like your high latency starts inside your own network at a peak of *120ms*. Your latency then continues to stick around peaks of *126ms* along your entire route before hitting our servers. I'd recommend rebooting your modem/router by unplugging them from power and plugging them back in after 5 minutes. If you still see latency issues in-game after that, I'd reach out to a tier 2 support agent at your ISP and provide them these traceroute results. This will give them context so they can launch an investigation to resolve this with you.

Let me know if you have any other questions.

I have the same issue as this player and I'm on a wired connection.  Years ago before the server change ups I ha 40 ping.  After the server move I had 80 ping.  Now I start the game at 40 but randomly jump to 150.  Like the OP, only game I have an issue with.
if you have nividia experience installed with drivers. remove experience leave the driver. I had same problem.  I tried many things, this fixed it. .
